intro: Cnidoscolus chayamansa, commonly known as the Mexican huito or chayamansa, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its palmate leaves and spiny stems. The plant produces small yellow flowers followed by edible, fleshy fruits that are often consumed raw or cooked. Its leaves are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
